Package eg.projects

Class AbstractProject

java.lang.Object
eg.projects.AbstractProject
All Implemented Interfaces:
Configurable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GenericProject, HtmlProject, JavaProject, PerlProject, PythonProject, RProject
public abstract class AbstractProject
extends java.lang.Object
implements Configurable
The configuration of a project

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractProject

      protected AbstractProject​(ProjectTypes projType, boolean useMainFile, java.lang.String sourceExtension)
      Parameters:
      projType - the project type which has a valaue in ProjectTypes
      useMainFile - true to indicate that the project uses a main file which is executed when the project is run
      sourceExtension - the extension of source files (or of the main file if extensions differ) without the period

  • Method Details

    • setConfiguringAction

      public final void setConfiguringAction​(java.awt.event.ActionListener al)
      Description copied from interface: Configurable
      Sets the ActionListener that is called when the entries in the settings window are confirmed. The listener calls Configurable.configure(java.lang.String) and assigns/updates the project if the configuration is successful
      Specified by:
      setConfiguringAction in interface Configurable
      Parameters:
      al - the ActionListener

    • openSettingsWindow

      Description copied from interface: Configurable
      Opens the settings window
      Specified by:
      openSettingsWindow in interface Configurable

    • configure

      public final boolean configure​(java.lang.String dir)
      Description copied from interface: Configurable
      Configures a project based on the entries in the settings window
      Specified by:
      configure in interface Configurable
      Parameters:
      dir - the directory that may be or be contained in the project directory named in the settings window
      Returns:
      true if the project could be configured

    • retrieve

      public final boolean retrieve​(java.lang.String dir)
      Tries to retrieve a project stored in a preferences file.

      First, a 'ProjConfig' file is searched in the specified directory or further upward the directory path. If this is not found, it is tested if the directory is contained in the project directory saved in the Prefs file in the program folder.

      Specified by:
      retrieve in interface Configurable
      Parameters:
      dir - the directory that may be or be contained in a stored project
      Returns:
      true if a stored project could be retrieved

    • projectType

      public final ProjectTypes projectType()
      Description copied from interface: Configurable

      Specified by:
      projectType in interface Configurable
      Returns:
      the type of project

    • usesProjectFile

      public final boolean usesProjectFile()
      Description copied from interface: Configurable
      Returns if the project uses a main file that is executed when the project is run
      Specified by:
      usesProjectFile in interface Configurable
      Returns:
      true if a main file is used, false otherwise

    • executableDirName

      public final java.lang.String executableDirName()
      Description copied from interface: Configurable
      Returns the last name of the directory where executable files are saved. This directory, if given, is deletable in the project explorer.
      Specified by:
      executableDirName in interface Configurable
      Returns:
      the name, the empty string if no such directory is given

      Specified by:

    • setCommandParameters

      protected abstract void setCommandParameters()
      Sets command parameters

    • locateMainFile

      protected boolean locateMainFile()
      Returns if the main project file can be located based on the last successful configuration or, if not, after re-configuring the project. A dialog which asks to open the settings window is shown if the file cannot be located.
      Returns:
      true if the main can be located

    • mainFileName

      protected java.lang.String mainFileName()
      Returns the name of main project file without extension
      Returns:
      the name

    • relMainFilePath

      protected java.lang.String relMainFilePath()
      Returns the pathname of the main project file relative to the project root
      Returns:
      the filepath

    • namespace

      protected java.lang.String namespace()
      Returns the namespace of the main file. This is a relative directory or directory path based at the sources directory if given or at the project root directory.
      Returns:
      the namespace; the empty string if no namespace is given

    • sourceDirName

      protected java.lang.String sourceDirName()
      Returns the name or the relative path of the sources directory
      Returns:
      the name; the empty string if no source directory is given

    • sourceExtension

      protected java.lang.String sourceExtension()
      Returns the extension of source files (or of the main file if extensions differ) with the beginning period
      Returns:
      the extension; null if no source extension is given

    • libraries

      protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> libraries()
      Returns the list of libraries
      Returns:
      the list or the empty list if no library is given

      Returns:

    • buildName

      protected java.lang.String buildName()
      Returns the name for a build. If no input is present in the text field for the build name a default name is returned.
      Returns:
      the name
